intro: Palicourea rigida f. brevistyla, commonly known as the short-styled palicourea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The flowers are typically white to pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and feature four stamens and a two-lobed stigma. This variety is distinguished by its shorter style compared to the typical form, a trait that contributes to its botanical classification. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in shaded, humid environments.
